src package¶

Submodules¶

src.utils module¶

src.utils.ROC(classes: ndarray, y_test: ndarray, y_score: ndarray) → None[source]¶

Plot the ROC curves and compute their areas.

Parameters:

  • classes (np.ndarray) – All the possible categories.

  • y_test (np.ndarray) – Section of the data that are used as test labels.

  • y_score (np.ndarray) – Decision function of X_test.

src.utils.categories_as_lists(df: DataFrame) → None[source]¶

Ensures that the category column contains lists of strings.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe to be checked.

src.utils.categories_as_strings(df: DataFrame) → None[source]¶

Ensures that the category column contains strings.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe to be checked.

src.utils.extract_kws(text: str, kw_model: keybert._model.KeyBERT, seed: List[str], top_n: int) → List[str][source]¶

Extract a list of top_n keywords for the input text using some seed-keywords given by seed.

Parameters:

  • text (string) – Text from which to extract keywords.

  • kw_model (keybert._model.KeyBERT) – KeyBERT model.

  • seed (list of strings) – Seed keywords that might guide the extraction of keywords.

  • top_n (int) – Number of keywords to extract.

Returns:

keywords – List of the top_n extracted keywords.

Return type:

list of strings

src.utils.is_string_series(s: Series) → bool[source]¶

Checks whether s series contains only strings.

Parameters:

s (pd.Series) – Series to be checked.

src.utils.plot_confusion_matrices(mat: ndarray, classes: ndarray) → None[source]¶

Plot the confusion matrices normalizing on columns.

Parameters:

  • mat (np.ndarray) – Confusion matrices given by the classification.

  • classes (np.ndarray) – All the possible categories.

src.utils.plot_df_counts(df: DataFrame, col: str) → dict[source]¶

Computes the occurrences of the lists in the col column of the df dataframe and plots histograms. Everything is repeated for the exploded dataframe.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe that contains the column col.

  • col (string) – Name of the column whose elements must be counted.

Returns:

dict_counts – Its keys are the names contained in col’s lists and its values are their occurrences.

Return type:

dictionary

src.utils.run_model(pipeline: sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline, X_train: pd.Series, X_test: pd.Series, y_train: np.ndarray, y_test: np.ndarray, multilabel: bool) → Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray] | np.ndarray[source]¶

Fit the data and predict a classification.

Parameters:

  • pipeline (sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline) – Pipeline that perform the vectorization and the classification on the given data.

  • X_train (pd.Series) – Section of the data that are used as train features.

  • X_test (pd.Series) – Section of the data that are used as test features.

  • y_train (numpy.ndarray) – Section of the data that are used as train labels.

  • y_test (numpy.ndarray) – Section of the data that are used as test labels.

  • multilabel (bool) – True if the prediction is multilabel, False otherwise.

Returns:

  • y_pred (numpy.ndarray) – Predictions of the test data.

  • mat (numpy.ndarray) – Confusion matrices.

src.utils.text_cleaner(text: str, nlp: spacy.lang.en.English) → str[source]¶

After joining interrupted words and tokenizing the text, lemmatize, remove bad words, special characters, punctuation and Spacy stopwords.

Parameters:

  • text (string) – Text to be cleaned.

  • nlp (spacy.lang.en.English) – Spacy model.

Returns:

clean_tokens – Cleaned text.

Return type:

string
